content: these deer are knitted in cascade 220 worsted yarn shades praline 9695 yarn a and beige 8021 yarn b and are made by following the instructions within either of the fox patterns combined with the modifications detailed in this pattern m o r e k n i t t i n g p a t t e r n s a r e a v a i l a b l e a t https //littlecottonrabbits com © copyright 2019 all rights reserved j u l i e w i l l i a m s l i t t l e c o t t o n r a b b i t s page 1 m a t e r i a l s n o t i o n s worsted or light aran yarn see fox pattern for knitting needles a pair each of straight 3mm us 2 5 quantity in a mid brown colour yarn a and 2 75mm us 2 and two 2 75mm us 2 dpns double pointed needles worsted or light aran yarn see fox pattern for quantity in a beige colour yarn b tapestry needle 4ply/fingering weight yarn approx 4m/4yds in a dark brown colour for the antlers f i n i s h e d s i z e finished deer is approx 23cm 9 inches from the tip scraps of 4ply black yarn 4ply for the eyes nose of the toes to the top of the head and facial features toy stuffing g a u g e a tiny button gauge for deer 6 stitches x 9 row to 1 inch gauge for clothes 7 stitches x 10 row to 1 inch this free deer pattern is a supplement pattern and within it you will find instructions for knitting a pair of antlers and detailed notes on how to adapt either of my two fox patterns fox in a flowered frock or fox in a star spangled sweater please note that in order to make a complete toy you will need to have purchased one of these fox patterns and follow the full instructions within that all of my patterns are suitable for intermediate knitting skills and assume an understanding of basic stitches and standard knitting terms i hope that you find the pattern enjoyable and are pleased with the deer that you make sssskk sslliipp sslliipp kknniitt slip a stitch as if to knit it to a b b r e v i a t i o n s the right-hand needle slip a second stitch in the same way slip both stitches together back to the left-hand these decrease methods are described in detail in the needle and knit together through the back loops excellent knitting help website https //www knittinghelp com/videos/decreases please note that when the pattern mentions cast kk22ttoogg kknit 2 stitches together on i use a cable cast on y a r n s u g g e s t i o n s
